thread.title: European Stocks Advance for Fourth Day After Greece Agreement
thread.title_full: European Stocks Advance for Fourth Day After Greece Agreement - Bloomberg Business

author: Cecile Vannucci
title: European Stocks Advance for Fourth Day After Greece Agreement
text:
European stocks rallied as Greece and its creditors reached an agreement.
The Stoxx Europe 600 Index rose 1.1 percent to 393.01 at 8:08 a.m. in London. All industry groups advanced, with banks climbing the most. France’s CAC 40 Index, Germany’s DAX Index and Spain’s IBEX 25 Index led gains among regional benchmark gauges.
Euro Stoxx 50 Index futures earlier erased a loss of as much as 1.2 percent amid reports that an accord had been reached. After almost 17 hours of talks in Brussels, Greece and European leaders agreed on reforms needed to start formal negotiations over a third bailout program, European Union President Donald Tusk said on Twitter.
The Stoxx 600 advanced 1.4 percent last week, jumping the most since November 2011 in the last two days on optimism that Greece would get a bailout. Developments in Greece have been dictating stock moves, with equities alternating between gains and losses almost every week since April.
The Stoxx 600, which rallied as much as 21 percent this year to a record in April, lost 6.1 percent since then through the end of last week as negotiations between Greece and its creditors dragged on.
